repnme.cdata!:
Gabon - Transport Sector Technical
            Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project is rated satisfactory, with
            a likely sustainability. Lessons suggest that the original
            project design included too many individual studies in the
            case of transport; conversely, the revision of the urban
            program was too concentrated, dependent solely on the
            performance of one contractor who under-performed. As it
            turned out, a limited number of experts were recruited, who
            established, and integrated the various urban, and transport
            sector outputs into an overall strategy, and investment
            plan. Despite more intensive management, this approach
            reduced the risk of poor performance, and forced an active
            involvement in strategy development. Furthermore, the
            persistent participatory approach taken by the coordination
            unit, as it relates to those working groups which were not
            functional in some sub-sectors, proved successful, in that
            its effective control was conducive to a more open dialogue
            on the urban strategy, raised the level of commitment, and
            allowed private participation. By and large, the success of
            the coordination unit lies in the fact that it operated
            independently from the Government, but the level of
            flexibility, endurance, and diplomacy is the unique merit of
            the individuals within the coordination unit. However, the
            exclusive focus on sector policy, and institutional reform,
            prevented a major accompanying investment package, which
            limited leverage in assuring long term application of policy reforms.

18225276.theme: Other urban development,Municipal governance and institution building,Regulation and competition policy
18225276.majtheme: Urban development,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Gabon - Transportation Sector Technical
            Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Transport Sector
            Technical Assistance Project are to: 1) strengthen the
            institutional management capacity of the Borrower's
            transport and urban sectors; 2) establish a transport sector
            strategy and an investment plan, including the promotion of
            improved sector efficiency, increased competition, reduction
            of transport costs, and the decrease in subsidies to public
            enterprises in the transport sector; 3) prepare the
            transport sector restructuring plan; 4) establish an urban
            sector development strategy and an investment plan aimed at
            improving urban investment planning, urban budgeting,
            management of existing infrastructure in Libreville, and
            urban land tenure system; and 5) execute an urban
            infrastructure improvement program in Libreville using
            labor-based methods. The project will consist of: a) policy
            support, institutional development activities and
            preparation of investment plans; b) execution of a pilot
            operation to test the use of labor-based methods in urban
            civil works; and c) equipment and financing of incremental
            operating costs related to project management.
